thread.title: At Least a Dozen Parade Attendees Injured After Truck Crashes Into New Orleans Crowd
thread.title_full: At Least a Dozen Parade Attendees Injured After Truck Crashes Into New Orleans Crowd

author: Ken Meyer
title: At Least a Dozen Parade Attendees Injured After Truck Crashes Into New Orleans Crowd
text:
At Least a Dozen Parade Attendees Injured After Truck Crashes Into New Orleans Crowd by Ken Meyer | 8:56 pm, February 25th, 2017 
At least a dozen people were reported injured in New Orleans on Saturday after a truck crashed into a crowd of observers at a Mardi Gras parade. 
WSDU reports that at around 7 p.m. local time, the vehicle ran into the Mid-City crowd at Orleans and Carrollton Avenue. An investigation is underway, though 12 people have been hospitalized, and they are reported in critical condition. #BREAKING According to NOPD, the number of people injured could increase as the investigation continues 
— Kristin Pierce (@KPierceTV) February 26, 2017 Endymion was rolling at the time the vehicles plowed onto parade watchers on neutral ground at Carrollton and Orleans. 
— Meg Farris (@megfarrisWWL) February 26, 2017 
UPDATE – 9:08 p.m. EST: WSDU has footage from the scene, and local police will soon hold a press meeting about the incident: Raw video via WDSU photog of scene after truck crashes into crowd along parade route. https://t.co/Ick74qhh1T (Viewer discretion advised) pic.twitter.com/Qcb8SiTovh 
— wdsu (@wdsu) February 26, 2017 
UPDATE – 9:13 p.m. EST: Police say that 21 people have been transported to the hospital. The driver responsible for the crash was said to have hit multiple vehicles before crashing, and police have said that the incident currently seems to be due to drunk driving, not terrorism. 
An arrest was made at the scene of the crime: Police arrest an man at scene after pickup truck slammed into Endymion crowd at Carrollton & Orleans https://t.co/dQdZfGFRCR pic.twitter.com/r5em0Nzqyh 
— New Orleans Advocate (@theadvocateno) February 26, 2017 
This story is developing, and we shall add new details as they come. 
[Image via screengrab]
